Hospital.Controllers

Class DiagnosisController

  • java.lang.Object
    • Hospital.Controllers.DiagnosisController

  • @SystemAPI
public class DiagnosisController
extends java.lang.Object
    The DiagnosisController is used by DoctorControllers to perform diagnosis-related actions, including:
    • Creating diagnoses
    • Approving/disapproving diagnoses
    • Determining the type of a diagnosis
    • Finding available doctors to ask a second opinion from
    To create a DiagnosisController, the LoginController of a logged in Doctor is required.

    • Method Detail

      • enterDiagnosis

        @SystemAPI
public java.lang.String enterDiagnosis(java.lang.String content,
                                        LoginInfo secondOpinion)
                                throws InvalidArgumentException,
                                       NoPersonWithNameAndRoleException,
                                       NoOpenedPatientFileException,
                                       PatientIsDischargedException,
                                       NotLoggedInException
        This creates a diagnosis with the given content and the optional secondOpinion doctor
        Parameters:
        content - The content of this diagnosis
        secondOpinion - The doctor that must approve the diagnosis
        Returns:
        a description of the created diagnosis
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - if the content was null and shouldn't be
        NoPersonWithNameAndRoleException - the given logininfo was not found in the system
        NoOpenedPatientFileException - no patientfile was opened
        PatientIsDischargedException - the patient was already discharged
        NotLoggedInException - the doctor has logged out

      • approveDiagnosis

        @SystemAPI
public java.lang.String approveDiagnosis(DiagnosisInfo diag)
                                  throws PatientIsDischargedException,
                                         NoOpenedPatientFileException,
                                         NotLoggedInException,
                                         InvalidDiagnosisException,
                                         CannotDoException
        Used to approve a diagnosis to which a second opinion was asked
        Parameters:
        diag - the DiagnosisInfo of the diagnosis to be approved
        Returns:
        details about the diagnosis
        Throws:
        PatientIsDischargedException - the patient the doctor is working on is already discharged
        NoOpenedPatientFileException - the doctor has no patientfile opened
        NotLoggedInException - the doctor is not logged in
        InvalidDiagnosisException - the diagnosis could not be found
        CannotDoException - this command could somehow not be executed, even though it was just created

      • disapproveDiagnosis

        @SystemAPI
public java.lang.String disapproveDiagnosis(DiagnosisInfo diag,
                                             java.lang.String details)
                                     throws CannotChangeException,
                                            NoPersonWithNameAndRoleException,
                                            NoOpenedPatientFileException,
                                            InvalidDiagnosisException,
                                            NotLoggedInException,
                                            InvalidArgumentException,
                                            PatientIsDischargedException
        Disapproves a diagnosis
        Parameters:
        diag - the diagnosis to disapprove
        details - to use
        Returns:
        the details of the new diagnosis made to correct the original
        Throws:
        CannotChangeException - if this happens, a newly created argument was somehow already answered
        NoOpenedPatientFileException - the doctor has no patientfile opened
        NotLoggedInException - the doctor is not logged in
        InvalidDiagnosisException - the diagnosis could not be found
        NoPersonWithNameAndRoleException - somehow something went wrong in finding the original doctor
        InvalidArgumentException - if the details were null
        PatientIsDischargedException

      • getAvailableSecondOpinionDoctors

        @SystemAPI
public LoginInfo[] getAvailableSecondOpinionDoctors()
                                             throws NotLoggedInException
        Gets a list of doctors available to a ask a second opinion from
        Returns:
        an array of LoginInfo's containing the information about available doctors
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - the doctor is not logged in
